result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael F Mehring Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: --to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge  plus $100 Domestic Abuse Surcharge

--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--No Contact with Paige Satermo, unless approved by DOC, Statute 973.049 Contact prohibition warnings /penailities given. 
--The Court makes an exception to the contact prohibition to allow for Mr. Mehring to have contact with Ms. Satermo only in court on the pending Small Claims case, conditional on Ms. Satermo agreeing, and only for the purposes of settling the Small Claims case with the Landlord or coordinating their defense 
--Complete certified Batters' Intervention programming as recommended by DOC
--No acts or threats of violence
The Court indicates that if Mr. Mehring completes the Certified Batters' Intervention Program earlier than the two year time period, the Defense may request modification of the Probation term length.

Arresting agency: LMPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael F Mehring Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 10:11am[MO]
Defendant Michael F Mehring in court with Attorney David Zarwell.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The State verifies victim rights compliance
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "Guilty" entered on Counts #2 and #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1 and #4.

On Counts #2 and #3, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--No Contact with Paige Satermo, unless approved by DOC, Statute 973.049 Contact prohibition warnings /penailities given. 
--The Court makes an exception to the contact prohibition to allow for Mr. Mehring to have contact with Ms. Satermo only in court on the pending Small Claims case, conditional on Ms. Satermo agreeing, and only for the purposes of settling the Small Claims case with the Landlord or coordinating their defense 
--Complete certified Batters' Intervention programming as recommended by DOC
--No acts or threats of violence
-- In Count #2 to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Abuse Surcharge
--In Count #3 to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  1  day
The Court orders the $500 cash bond is to be applied to his costs/ fees/ surcharges.
The Court indicates that if Mr. Mehring completes the Certified Batters' Intervention Program earlier than the two year time period, the Defense may request modification of the Probation term length. 
recess:10:43am
Status conference on February 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on January 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 10:51 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Michael F Mehring in court. ADA John E K Fryatt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

DOB & address confirmed accurate; Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court continues $500 cash bond, already posted, with conditions: 
-No contact with Paige Satermo
-No presence at Paige Satermo's residence of place of business
-No acts or threats of violence anyone 
Recess: 10:56 am 

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 1/28/15 at 9:00 am - Send notices (2) Future scheduling after DA PTC - Send notices
